td.content: 4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread
shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere

td.content: s:patient complains of severe right shoulder pain, mild shortness of breath, moderate loss of appetite and Cancer and other medical problems. NKDA. patient is a 34 YO white female. she has a history of smoking Alcohol 1-4 beers/month o:Height 150 cm, Weight 43.9 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, Contrast-enhanced CT Chest 4.6 x 5.1 x 4.6 cm mass in the aortopulmonary window encasing the left pulmonary artery, a 1.9-cm subcarinal lymph node, and a mass in the left upper lobe of the lung measuring 2.5 x 2.1 cm with suspicious regional lymphangitic spread, Contrast-enhanced MRI brain shows 2 enhancing cerebral metastases of lung cancer in the left cerebral hemisphere a:Lung Cancer p:administered cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, performed Contrast-enhanced CT Chest, Contrast-enhanced MRI brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
